result.title: Set of four supporting tools for the U-CERT services
result.description: Deliverable 5.4 collects a set digital supporting tools that include:1.The U-CERT Comparison and calculation toolkit for national Annexes. 2.A Service tool for product suppliers, transforming product information into suitable input for energy calculations.3.The U-CERT Open data solution. One of the main goals of this open data solution is to feed and enrich (future) Building Renovation Passports and Energy label atlases (such as energielabelatlas.nl and enerfund.eu).4.The U-CERT Building Operational Rating solution (cloud-based service accessible through any web browser with an user account) enabling an evidence based decision-making process.

result.title: Proceedings of the second conference
result.description: The Lithuanian partners will organise two international scientific conferences on WtE in Lithuania In M18 at VMU In M30 at LEIIn both cases WIP who has great experience in organising conferences will actively support the Lithuanian partners in terms of planning and logistical management of the eventsThe conferences will have the following themes VMU Conference on Moving towards sustainable customer behaviour in the 4th industrial revolution LEI Conference on Prospects of advanced wastetoenergy technologies in the Baltic regionThe TWINPEAKS project partners will constitute the conference committee and will all contribute to the organisation Each conference will last 3 days and will be restricted to researchers and students except a series of keynote sessions open to all publics in order to disseminate academic knowledge to the broadest audience It is expected each conference will attract 40 national and international researchers Two researchers from each of the Twinning partners will be invited as plenary speakersThe conferences will also include a PhD symposium Task 43 and will overlap with a summer school Task 42 so that students and earlystage researchers can also participate in the conferenceThe conference will be advertised and reported on the project website and social networks Task 35 The consortium will also distribute leaflets about the project Task 33 during the conference and present it during the inauguration ceremony of the conferenceLEI will write conference proceedings that will serve as the deliverable reporting the event deliverables 36 and 38 The conference attendance review will be part of the dissemination communication and exploitation annual reports written by LEI D37 and D39

result.description: The Lithuanian partners will organise two international scientific conferences on WtE in Lithuania In M18 at VMU In M30 at LEIIn both cases WIP who has great experience in organising conferences will actively support the Lithuanian partners in terms of planning and logistical management of the eventsThe conferences will have the following themes VMU Conference on Moving towards sustainable customer behaviour in the 4th industrial revolution LEI Conference on Prospects of advanced wastetoenergy technologies in the Baltic regionThe TWINPEAKS project partners will constitute the conference committee and will all contribute to the organisation Each conference will last 3 days and will be restricted to researchers and students except a series of keynote sessions open to all publics in order to disseminate academic knowledge to the broadest audience It is expected each conference will attract 40 national and international researchers Two researchers from each of the Twinning partners will be invited as plenary speakersThe conferences will also include a PhD symposium Task 43 and will overlap with a summer school Task 42 so that students and earlystage researchers can also participate in the conferenceThe conference will be advertised and reported on the project website and social networks Task 35 The consortium will also distribute leaflets about the project Task 33 during the conference and present it during the inauguration ceremony of the conferenceLEI will write conference proceedings that will serve as the deliverable reporting the event deliverables 36 and 38 The conference attendance review will be part of the dissemination communication and exploitation annual reports written by LEI D37 and D39
